description: Each record represents an order, enriched with metrics about related charges and line items. Line items are aggregated at the billing (order) level.
table_description: Each record represents an order, enriched with metrics about related charges and line items.

columns.description: The unique identifier of the order.
The ID for the order in your external ecommerce platform.
The order number in your external ecommerce platform.
Unique numeric identifier for the customer associated with the order.
The email address of the customer.
The date and time the order was created.
The status of the order. Possible values are SUCCESS, ERROR, QUEUED, CANCELLED.
The date and time the order was last updated.
The unique identifier of the charge.
The unique identifier of the transaction.
The status of the charge. Possible values are SUCCESS, ERROR, QUEUED, SKIPPED, REFUNDED, PARTIALLY_REFUNDED.
Boolean indicating if the Order is prepaid.
The total amount due of the order.
Possible values are CHECKOUT, RECURRING.
The date and time the order was processed.
The date time of when the associated order is/was scheduled to process.
The date and time the order was shipped.
The unique identifier of the address.
Boolean indicating if the order (record) is deleted.
The date and time the charge was created.
The name of the payment processor.
A comma-separated list of tags on the charge.
The number of orders generated from this charge (Will be >1 for prepaid).
Possible values are CHECKOUT, RECURRING.
The total amount due of the charge.
The charge_total_price divided equally amongst all orders stemming from the same charge
The combined price of all charge line_items minus any discounts. Does not include taxes and shipping.
The charge_subtotal_price divided equally amongst all orders stemming from the same charge.
The tax lines associated with the charge.
The charge_tax_lines divided equally amongst all orders stemming from the same charge.
The sum of the discounts applied to the charge.
The charge_total_discounts divided equally amongst all orders stemming from the same charge.
The sum of all refunds that were applied to the charge.
The charge_total_refunds divided equally amongst all orders stemming from the same charge.
The total tax due associated with the charge.
The charge_total_tax divided equally amongst all orders stemming from the same charge.
The total weight of all items in the charge in grams.
The charge_total_weight_grams divided equally amongst all orders stemming from the same charge.
The total shipping costs associated with the charge.
The charge_total_shipping divided equally amongst all orders stemming from the same charge.
The total number of items in the order.
The total price of all line items in the order. Does not include discounts, shipping, or tax.
The total net value of the charge, calculated as the total price minus total discounts.
The total_net_charge_value divided equally amongst all orders stemming from the same charge.

description: Each record represents a specific line item charge, refund, or other line item that accumulates into final charges.
table_description: Each record represents a specific line item charge, refund, or other line item that accumulates into final charges.

columns.description: The unique identifier of the charge.
Unique row number assigned to line items with the same charge_id.
The line item's primary key index carried over from its source.
The date and time the charge was created.
The unique identifier of the customer.
The unique identifier of the address.
The amount charged for the line item.
The title of the line item.
The type of the line item. Possible values are (charge line, discount, shipping, tax, or refund).

description: Each record provides totals and running totals for a customer's associated transactions for the specified day.
table_description: Each record provides totals and running totals for a customer's associated transaction for the specified day.

columns.description: The unique identifier of the customer.
Day the metrics were calculated.
Week the metrics were calculated.
Month the metrics were calculated.
Year the metrics were calculated.
The number of orders for the customer on the given day.
The number of subscriptions created for the customer on the given day.
The number of one-time orders for the customer on the given day.
The total amount charges associated with the customer on the given day.
Total price for successful orders by the customer on the given day.
Total discounts for successful orders by the customer on the given day.
Total tax for successful orders by the customer on the given day.
Total refunds for successful orders by the customer on the given day.
The charge_total_discounts_realized divided equally amongst all orders stemming from the same charge.
The charge_total_tax_realized divided equally amongst all orders stemming from the same charge.
The charge_total_price_realized divided equally amongst all orders stemming from the same charge.
The charge_total_refunds_realized divided equally amongst all orders stemming from the same charge.
Order line item total for successful orders by the customer on the given day.
Total number of items successfully ordered by the customer on the given day.
The total net value of recurring charges, calculated as the total price minus total discounts.
The total net value of one-time charges, calculated as the total price minus total discounts.
The charge_recurring_net_amount_realized divided equally amongst all orders stemming from the same charge.
The charge_one_time_net_amount_realized divided equally amongst all orders stemming from the same charge.
Running total of price for successful orders by the customer.
Running total of discounts for successful orders by the customer.
Running total of tax for successful orders by the customer.
Running total of refunds for successful orders by the customer.
The charge_total_discounts_running_total divided equally amongst all orders stemming from the same charge.
The charge_total_tax_running_total divided equally amongst all orders stemming from the same charge.
The charge_total_price_running_total divided equally amongst all orders stemming from the same charge.
The charge_total_refunds_running_total divided equally amongst all orders stemming from the same charge.
Order line item running total for successful orders by the customer.
Running total of items successfully ordered by the customer.
Running total of the net value of recurring charges.
Running total of the net value of one-time charges.
Running total of the net value of the calculated recurring order amount.
Running total of the net value of the calculated one-time order amount.
The number of months the customer has been active up to the given day.

description: Each record represents a customer, enriched with metrics about their associated transactions.
table_description: Each record represents a customer, enriched with metrics about their associated transactions.

columns.description: The unique identifier of the customer.
The unique string identifier used in a customer portal link.
The ID for the customer in your external ecommerce platform.
The email address of the customer.
The customer's first name.
The customer's last name.
The date and time the customer was created.
The date and time the customer was last updated.
The date and time of the customer's first processed charge.
The number of active subscriptions associated with the customer.
The total number of subscriptions associated with the customer.
Boolean indicating if the payment value is valid.
Boolean indicating if the customer has a credit card in dunning.
Boolean indicating if the customer is tax exempt.
The total number of orders associated with the customer.
The total amount associated with the customer.
The average order amount for the customer.
The total price of all line items in the customer's orders.
The average price of line items in the customer's orders.
The average quantity of items per order for the customer.
The total amount charged to the customer.
The average amount charged to the customer.
The total number of charges made to the customer.
The total amount of tax applied to the customer's orders.
The total amount of discounts applied to the customer's orders.
The total refunds issued for the customer.
The total number of one-time purchases made by the customer.
The total net spend of the customer, calculated as the total amount charged minus total refunds.

The number of active subscriptions for the customer, calculated as the sum of subscriptions with status ACTIVE.  Note - this value may differ from the Recharge-provided subscriptions_active_count. See DECISIONLOG for more information.
Indicates whether the customer currently has an active subscription.
Indicates whether the customer has made their first charge in the past 30 days.
The number of months since making their first charge.
The monthly average number of orders placed by the customer.
The monthly average amount ordered by the customer.
The monthly average number of one-time purchases made by the customer.
The monthly average amount charged to the customer.
The monthly average amount discounted for the customer.
The monthly average amount taxed for the customer.
The monthly average net spend of the customer, calculated as the total amount charged minus total refunds, divided by the number of months since the first charge.

description: Each record represents a customer, MRR, and non-MRR generated on a monthly basis.
table_description: Each record represents a customer, MRR, and non-MRR generated on a monthly basis.

columns.description: Month the metrics were calculated.
The unique identifier of the customer.
The number of successful recurring orders counted in the month.
The current net monthly recurring revenue for the customer based on charges, taking into account discounts and refunds.

The current net monthly recurring revenue for the customer based on orders, taking into account discounts and refunds. This is the recurring charges divided equally amongst all orders stemming from the same charge.
The number of successful one-time orders counted in the month.
The current net monthly one-time revenue for the customer based on charges, taking into account discounts and refunds.

The current net monthly one-time revenue for the customer based on orders, taking into account discounts and refunds. This is the one-time charges divided equally amongst all orders stemming from the same charge.

description: Each record represents a single event collected by Google Analytics 4, including user, device, and other metadata.
table_description: Contains event-level data exported from Google Analytics 4.

columns.description: The date on which the event was logged, in the format YYYYMMDD (local time).
The timestamp (in microseconds) marking when the event was logged on the client.
The name of the event (e.g. 'page_view', 'purchase').
The parameter key included with the event (part of the repeated event_params record).
A string value associated with event_params.key.
An integer value associated with event_params.key.
A float value associated with event_params.key.
A double-precision float value associated with event_params.key.
When this parameter value was set (in microseconds).
The timestamp (in microseconds) of the previous event by the same user.
The monetary value (in USD) of the event (if applicable, e.g. purchase).
Index of this event in the session bundle (if events were bundled).
Difference (in microseconds) between event_timestamp and when data was processed by the Analytics server.
An identifier provided by your website/app to uniquely identify a user.
A pseudo-identifier assigned by Analytics to track users when user_id is not set.
Boolean indicating whether analytics cookies/storage were allowed for the event.
Boolean indicating whether ads cookies/storage were allowed for the event.
Boolean indicating whether the event used a transient token.
A key for a user property (part of the repeated user_properties record).
A string value for the user property.
An integer value for the user property.
A float value for the user property.
A double-precision float value for the user property.
The time (in microseconds) when this user property was set.
The timestamp (in microseconds) of the user's first recorded event.
Lifetime value revenue associated with the user (in the user’s preferred currency).
Three-letter ISO_4217 currency code for the user_ltv.revenue field.
Category of the device (desktop, tablet, or mobile).
Brand of the mobile device (e.g., Apple, Samsung).
Model of the mobile device (e.g., iPhone 12).
Marketing name for the device if available (e.g., Galaxy S21).
Information about the device's operating system and hardware model.
Operating system of the device (e.g., iOS, Android).
Version of the operating system (e.g., 14.4).
Device vendor identifier, if available.
The Advertising ID (e.g., IDFA on iOS, or AdID on Android).
Language setting of the device (e.g., en-us, fr).
Boolean indicating if the user has enabled limit ad tracking.
Time zone offset from UTC in seconds.
Name of the browser (e.g., Chrome, Safari).
Browser version string (e.g., 89.0.4389.105).
Browser name for web events (similar to device.browser).
Browser version for web events (similar to device.browser_version).
Host name for web events (e.g., yoursite.com).
Screen resolution of the device (e.g., 1920x1080).
User’s continent (e.g., Americas, Europe).
User’s country (based on IP geolocation).
User’s region (e.g., state or province).
User’s sub-continent (e.g., Northern Europe).
Metro code of the user’s location (mainly for the US).
User’s city (based on IP geolocation).
A numeric ID for the city (internal to Google).
Approximate device latitude (if available).
Approximate device longitude (if available).
The user’s network provider or ISP.
App’s bundle ID (e.g., com.example.app).
App’s version (e.g., 2.1.0).
Store the app was installed from (e.g., Google Play).
The Firebase App ID associated with the event.
Marketing campaign source (e.g., google, newsletter).
Marketing campaign medium (e.g., cpc, email).
Combined source that might show as '(direct)' if unknown.
An identifier for the data stream where this event was sent.
Platform of the event (e.g., web, ios, android).
Additional event dimensions (if any) that are not part of event_params.
Sum of quantities for all items in this event (if ecommerce data is present).
Purchase revenue (in USD) for ecommerce events.
Tax amount (in USD) for the purchase.
Shipping cost (in USD) for the purchase.
Amount refunded (in USD) for this ecommerce event.
Unique ID for the item in the ecommerce event.
Name of the item.
Brand of the item.
Variant of the item (e.g., color, size).
Item category or product category. Some exports include item_category2 through item_category5.
Secondary item category.
Tertiary item category.
Quaternary item category.
Quinary item category.
Price of a single item (in USD).
The number of items purchased or returned in this event.
Coupon code applied to this item (if any).
Affiliation or store name where transaction occurred.
Location ID (e.g., store or physical location) for the event.
The (optional) ID of the item list in which the item was presented.
The (optional) name of the item list in which the item was presented.
The position of the item in the list or impression (1-based).

description: Each record (row) represents a single session in a Universal Analytics 360 property, with nested and repeated records for hits and other detailed data.
table_description: Contains session-level data exported from Google Analytics 360 (Universal Analytics). One row per session.

columns.description: A unique, anonymous identifier for the user. Corresponds to the Client ID in UA.
A session identifier for this user. Typically derived from the start time of the session.
The sequential session index for this user (e.g., the 1st session, 2nd session, etc.).
The timestamp (in Unix seconds) for when the session began.
The date (YYYYMMDD) for the session based on the property’s timezone.
The User ID associated with this session (if set in your Universal Analytics code).
The Client ID for this session (if available).
The default channel grouping (e.g., Organic Search, Direct, Referral, etc.).
Indicates whether a session originates from social interaction (e.g., 'Socially Engaged' or 'Not Socially Engaged').
Index (number) of the custom dimension set at the session level.
Value or string set for the corresponding custom dimension index.
Index (number) of the custom metric set at the session level.
Value (integer) for the corresponding custom metric index.
The name of the browser used for this session (e.g., Chrome).
The version of the browser used (e.g., 88.0.4324.150).
The operating system used (e.g., Windows, MacOS, iOS, Android).
The version of the operating system (e.g., Windows 10).
Boolean indicating if the session originated from a mobile device.
Brand of the mobile device (e.g., Apple, Samsung).
Model of the mobile device (e.g., iPhone 12).
Type of input for the mobile device (e.g., touch, clickwheel).
Screen resolution (e.g., 1920x1080).
Screen color depth (e.g., 24-bit).
Version of Flash installed on the device (if any).
Language setting of the browser/OS (e.g., en-us).
Boolean indicating if Java is enabled on the browser.
The full User-Agent string for the browser.
High-level category of the device (desktop, tablet, or mobile).
User’s continent (e.g., Americas, Europe).
More specific sub-continent (e.g., Northern America).
User’s country (based on IP geolocation).
User’s region (state or province, if known).
Metro code for the user’s location (in the US).
User’s city (based on IP geolocation).
A numeric ID for the city (internal to Google).
The network domain of the user’s ISP.
Approximate latitude of the user’s location.
Approximate longitude of the user’s location.
The ISP or network provider name.
The name of the marketing campaign (if applicable).
Referring source for the session (e.g., google, newsletter).
Marketing medium (e.g., cpc, email, referral).
Paid search keyword (if available).
Ad content description or promotional text (if applicable).
Campaign ID from AdWords (if available).
Ad group ID from AdWords (if available).
Google Click ID for auto-tagging (if available).
Page number in the AdWords pagination (if any).
Ad slot (e.g., top, side) from AdWords (if available).
Additional AdWords targeting criteria (if available).
The path of the referring URL (if referral source).
Number of visits in this session. Typically ‘1’ for Universal Analytics.
Count of total hits (pageviews, events, etc.) in the session.
Count of pageviews in the session.
The total time spent by the user during the session (in seconds).
Indicates if the session was a bounce (1 = bounced).
Number of ecommerce transactions in the session.
Total revenue (in micros of the local currency) from ecommerce transactions.
Indicates a user’s first session on your property (if 1).
Total screen views (for mobile app tracking) in the session.
Count of unique screen views in the session.
Goal value (in local currency) for a particular goal (XX = goal index).
Total count of all goals completed in the session.
Number of completions for a particular goal (XX = goal index).
A dimension that estimates session quality based on user engagement.
Hit sequence number (1-based) within the session.
Offset (in milliseconds) from the start of the session when this hit occurred.
Hour of the day (0–23) in the property’s local timezone when this hit was logged.
Minute of the hour (0–59) in the property’s local timezone when this hit was logged.
Boolean indicating if this hit was an interaction event (applies to event hits).
Indicates if this hit was the entrance pageview for the session.
Indicates if this hit was the exit pageview for the session.
The requested page path (e.g., /home).
Hostname used to request the page (e.g., www.example.com).
The title of the requested page.
Internal search keyword (if the hit is from a site search).
Internal search category (if used).
Breakdown of the page path at level 1, if page path is hierarchical.
Transaction ID for this ecommerce hit.
Revenue for the transaction (in micros of the local currency).
Tax amount for the transaction (in micros).
Shipping cost for the transaction (in micros).
Store or affiliation name associated with the transaction.
Transaction ID corresponding to the item (product).
Name of the product purchased (or refunded).
Category of the product (if provided).
SKU or unique ID of the product.
Quantity of the product item in this hit.
Revenue attributed to this specific item (in micros).
Screen name (mobile app tracking) for this hit.
Landing screen name if this is the first screen in the session.
Exit screen name if this is the final screen in the session.
Number of times this screen was viewed (usually 1 per screen hit).
Boolean indicating if an app exception is fatal.
Description of the exception (if provided).
Ecommerce action type (e.g., 'click', 'add', 'purchase').
Option or label for an ecommerce action (e.g., checkout step option).
Step number in a multi-step ecommerce checkout process.
Additional value associated with the ecommerce action option.
Enhanced Ecommerce product name.
Enhanced Ecommerce product category (may have multiple levels).
Brand of the product in Enhanced Ecommerce.
Price of the product in Enhanced Ecommerce (in micros).
Quantity of the product in Enhanced Ecommerce.
Revenue derived from this product (in micros).
Promotion ID if this hit is related to a promo.
Promotion name if this hit is related to a promo.
Creative text or ad content for the promotion.
ID of the Google Optimize experiment (if applicable).
Variant ID the user was exposed to in the experiment.
Content group #1 for this hit (if configured).
Content group #2 for this hit (if configured).
Content group #3 for this hit (if configured).
Content group #4 for this hit (if configured).
Content group #5 for this hit (if configured).
Index of the custom dimension set on this specific hit.
Value for the custom dimension associated with this hit.
Index of the custom metric set on this hit.
Value for the custom metric associated with this hit (usually an integer).
